Package org.opensextant.giscore.output.kml

Class KmlWriter

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.output.kml.KmlWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, IGISOutputStream
public class KmlWriter extends Object implements IGISOutputStream
Wrapper to KmlOutputStream for handling the common steps needed to create basic KML or KMZ files.

Handles the following tasks:

  • write to KMZ/KML files transparently. If file has a .kmz file extension (or .zip) then a KMZ (ZIP) file is created with that file name.
  • discards empty containers if ContainerStart is immediately followed by a ContainerEnd element in a successive write() call.
  • write Files or contents from inputStream to entries in KMZ for networkLinked content, overlay images, icons, etc.
Complements the KmlReader class. Advanced KML support with more direct access may require using the KmlOutputStream or KmzOutputStream classes directly.
Author:
Jason Mathews, MITRE Corp. Created: Mar 13, 2009 10:06:17 AM

  • Constructor Details

    • KmlWriter

      public KmlWriter(File file, String encoding) throws IOException
      Construct a KmlWriter which starts writing a KML document into the specified KML or KMZ file. If file name ends with .kmz or .zip extension then a compressed KMZ (ZIP) file is produced with the main KML document stored as "doc.kml" in the root directory.

      For details on .KMZ files see tutorial at ...

      Parameters:
      file - the file to be opened for writing.
      encoding - the encoding to use, if null default encoding (UTF-8) is assumed
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • KmlWriter

      public KmlWriter(File file) throws IOException
      Construct a KmlWriter which starts writing a KML document into the specified KML or KMZ file. If filename ends with .kmz or .zip extension then a compressed KMZ (ZIP) file is produced with the main KML document stored as "doc.kml" in the root directory.

      For details on .KMZ files see "Creating a .kmz Archive" section of ...

      Parameters:
      file - the file to be opened for writing.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • KmlWriter

      public KmlWriter(KmlOutputStream os)
      Construct a KmlWriter with KmlOutputStream. Basically wraps a KmlOutputStream with KmlWriter.
      Parameters:
      os - the KmlOutputStream to be opened for writing, never null.

  • Method Details

    • isCompressed

      public boolean isCompressed()
      Tests whether the output file is a compressed KMZ file.
      Returns:
      true if the output file is a compressed KMZ file; false otherwise*

    • write

      public void write(File file, String entryName) throws IOException
      Write file contents into entry of compressed KMZ file. File can itself be KML, image, model or other file. Contents are not parsed or validated. This must be called after entire KML for main document "doc.kml" is written.
      Parameters:
      file - file to write into the KMZ
      entryName - the entry name for file as it will appear in the KMZ. This should be a root-level or relative file path (e.g. myOtherData.kml or images/image.png). As in any other zip file, entry names must be unique.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      IllegalArgumentException - if arguments are null or KmlWriter is not writing a compressed KMZ file

    • write

      public void write(InputStream is, String entryName) throws IOException
      Write contents from InputStream into file named localName in compressed KMZ file. This must be called after entire KML for main document doc.kml is written. Note the InputStream is closed upon exit of this method.
      Parameters:
      is - InputStream to write into the KMZ
      entryName - the entry name for file as it will appear in the KMZ. This should be a root-level or relative file path (e.g. myOtherData.kml or images/image.png). As in any other zip file, entry names must be unique.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      IllegalArgumentException - if arguments are null
      IllegalStateException - if KmlWriter is not writing a compressed KMZ file

    • write

      public void write(IGISObject object)
      Write GISObject into KML output stream.
      Specified by:
      write in interface IGISOutputStream
      Parameters:
      object - IGISObject object to write
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if KmlOutputStream is closed. If underlying processing throws an XMLStreamException then it will rethrow it wrapped with an IllegalStateException.

    • close

      public void close(boolean closeStream)
      Close this KmlWriter and free any resources associated with the writer.
      Parameters:
      closeStream - Flag to close the underlying stream. If false then underlying stream is left open otherwise closed along with other resources.

    • normalizeUrls

      public static void normalizeUrls(IGISObject o)
      Normalize and restore URLs from internal URIs as rewritten in KmlReader.read() if applicable. Only IGISObjects that haves URL attributes may be affected (i.e., NetworkLink, Overlay, and Style) and only if original href had a relative URL which gets rewritten to include the parent KML/KMZ document.

      For example, given a relative URL href=child.kml in NetworkLink root KML document (doc.kml) from base resource URL ... gets rewritten as kmzhttp://target/test.kmz?file=child.kml from which to resolve the child.kml document. The normalized form of this URI is the original "child.href" value.

      Parameters:
      o - IGISObject to normalize, never null
